title: Found You, Faker!
summary: This has been stuck in my head ever since I started the hoodie series and finally it's been drawn!!

imgs.alt: A digital comic of Sho Minamimoto from NEO: The World Ends With You, meeting another version of himself. The team's Minamimoto says, "I finally found you..." and reveals he is wearing a Shadow the Hedgehog hoodie under his coat. Then he and the other Minamimoto say at the same time "FAKER!" The other Minamimoto is wearing a Sonic the Hedgehog hoodie. From a distance, a confused Fret, Nagi, Rindo and Shoka watch the two Minamimotos.

Two doodles of Sho Minamimoto from NEO: The World Ends With You, one wearing a Sonic the Hedgehog hoodie and the other wearing a Shadow the Hedgehog hoodie. The Sonic one says excitedly, "SO ZETTA SLOW!" and the Shadow one says sadly, "The order of operations..."

title: VOID MEW
summary: Hazuki tried crafting a Mr. Mew and the result is questionable.

imgs.alt: Digital art of Hazuki Mikagi holding a special Mr. Mew from NEO The World Ends With You. This Mr. Mew has a cat like smile but the white eyes and mouth have been replaced by black eyes with white outlines that glow red. The background is an abstract city like form make out of squares and rectangles. There are also 3 rows of yellow barcode like shapes in the background.

title: His Ward
summary: The idea for this was meant to be the "other side" of the "Shibuya Fish Tank" but I wanted to draw Hazuki not all glowy so we got this instead! The wings were a last minute idea! I was adding the background shadows and on a whim I blocked in some shadowy wings on the walls and was like...Oh no! I love this but I also want this done! The less refined they were the better the shadowy wings looked so they're not as Funky as others I've done.

imgs.alt: Digital art of Hazuki Mikagi from NEO: The World Ends with you holding a glowing orb containing the Shinjuku area in Tokyo. Behind him are shadowy wings with glowing eyes in the thicker parts looking at the orb.

Digital art of Hazuki Mikagi from NEO: The World Ends with you holding a glowing orb containing the Shinjuku area in Tokyo. Behind him are glowing feathery wings with a darker skeletal shape inside. The skeletal wings have glowing eyes in the thicker parts looking at the orb.

title: NEO Joshua Anime Photoshops
summary: Some photoshopped NEO Joshuas and some Composer versions cause I was feeling rusty. Plus some before and after gifs cause it was cool seeing the changes.
details:
The Composer versions are actual redraws but for the human forms I just drew on top of the anime screenshots cause I was feeling lazy and wanted to try and keep the anime feel. I thought it might be easier but honestly I don’t think it was because of the gradients they use on top.

Tagging @rainbow-nijisaki (Tumblr) and @black-quadrant (Tumblr) since apparently we were all thinking of anime NEO Joshua about the same time. I was doing Composer form redraws from anime screenshots when the redraws were first posted by rainbow-nijisaki, (so if you like these and you haven’t seen those ones, please go check them out!) which inspired me to try some human NEO Joshuas. I guess we had anime related Joshuas on the mind!

imgs.alt: A screenshot edit of Joshua from The World Ends With You Animation to make it look like his NEO self. He looks very serious.
A screenshot redraw Joshua from The World Ends With You Animation to make it look like his NEO Composer self. He looks very serious.
A screenshot edit of Joshua from The World Ends With You Animation to make it look like his NEO self. His arms are crossed and he has a dangerous smile.
A screenshot edit of Joshua from The World Ends With You Animation to make it look like his NEO self. Joshua is looking down and to the side, holding a blue glowing like flame.
A screenshot redraw of Joshua from The World Ends With You Animation to make it look like his NEO Composer self. Joshua is looking down and to the side, holding his hand up.
A gif showing Joshua from the TWEWY animation and the screenshot edit of his NEO self. He looks very serious.
A gif showing Joshua from the TWEWY animation and the screenshot edit of his NEO self. His arms are crossed and he has a dangerous smile.
A gif showing Joshua from the TWEWY animation and the screenshot edit of his NEO self. Joshua is looking down and to the side, holding a blue glowing like flame.

title: Executor, It’s Your Time!
summary: Kubo’s turn for funky wings! They’re a mix of scythes, (goose) feathers, and making them abstract like what I did for Joshua.
details: Back for TWEWYOBER2021, there was a prompt called "Creation" that I wanted to do a NEO version. At the time, NEO was still too new, so I made a Hanekoma and Red SKull Pin version. Years later, I finally got around to making the NEO version with Kubo that I originally wanted to.

A single page comic with NEO: The World Ends With You characters and OCs. Hazuki says, "Everyone, I picked up freshly styled shoes." He shows his camo patterned slip on shoes with the pattern oriented vertically. Hazuki continues, "Fashionable, don't you think?" 

The next panel shows the same image of the shoes, but faded, and the camo pattern it oriented horizontally. A chibi head of Joshua is thinking "it's just...rotated". A chibi head next to him with long hair, Father, is smiling and giving a thumbs up with a heart bubble.

title: Mother: Crafting, Creating
summary: First attempt at making a “creating an Angel” piece. Eventually became a comic.
details: When I first saw the reference image from a smaller thumbnail I thought there was a halo, so I wanted to do something with it.

imgs.alt: A black and white drawing of a woman with a short ponytail and a suit, has a man lying beneath her. A circular light source shines from above her head, looking like a halo.

REFALT1: Image of a masked doctor under a bright circular light, hovering over a masked patient.

title: Act A Friend
summary:
NEO Composer Neku AU: Haz says hello to the new Composer of Shibuya. This was my first time drawing Haz and it was super challenging. Still like a lot of them. When I wrote him I felt like he was a little off, but I liked how he turned out.

The end of page 3 is still my fave part when he drops Joshua's name. Making the fragmented/scratchy words was fun to make too.
details:
Original posted notes:

I started this a year ago and had like 85% finished. So Just in one evening I finished the remaining bits while keeping the original tone. I tried not to go back and redraw anything, so these were the earliest Hazs I’ve drawn.

Some notes from the original draft:

I’ve kept Neku’s hoodie from the AU, even though there could be a development between Haz and Neku with comfier clothing!

I’m not sure how I want to write Haz, but since looks up to Joshua and wants to follow in his footsteps, I wonder if Joshua has mentioned or used nicknames, calling others by friendlier terms, to try and break the ice and make connections. And maybe… maybe Haz had a feeling something wasn’t quite right with that, and now Neku is here to explain that.

(Present (earliest post date) note: If there weren’t drawing fatigue there would be something about Nao, who used nicknames but was genuinely friendly. I think the initial freakout of hearing “Nekky” was going to have a Nao flashback since she was the one that called him Nekky.)

Something like that. And/or Haz is feeling a little lost without Joshua around. So if you’re wondering how to read Haz and it’s hard…it’s intentional. I’m just rolling with the uneasy, awkward and sad feelings that could be here for Neku and Haz.

(Present (earliest post date) note: I debated which Shiki to use, and with more energy I would have have overlaided RG Shiki but…I got lazy. The only new last minute effect I introduced is the “”“intense”“” words Haz uses that are scratchy/glowy.)

imgs.alt: Comic page 1 of 5. Neku in his Angelic white glowing form sits and another glowing figure appears beside him and says "Hello, Friend." Neku looks unimpressed and asks, "Who are you?" From below and behind, 3/4 view, hair covering his face, the figure says "I'm Shinjuku's Composer." The figure's hair falls back to show sharp eyes and sharp smile, and says sharply, "Friend." Neku looks down and away, a little angry and annoyed. "Don't call me 'friend'. My name is Neku Sakuraba. And-"

Comic page 2 of 5. A far away shot of Neku sitting down and the other figure floating beside him, looking at a window plane of Shibuya. Neku asks his question "You gonna sit down?" The figure shifts down next to Neku. "Hmm," he says, "Of course, Nekky." The word "Nekky" is fractured. Neku freaks out and exclaims, "NEKKY?!" Close of of the other being as he introduces himself, "I'm Hazuki Mikagi. But you can call me Haz, my friend." The word "friend" is fractured.

Comic page 3 of 5. Neku stutters, "Th-that's- Look, just call me Neku!" Haz watches smugly. Haz comments, "Strange, I've heard it's a good way to make friends." The word "friends" is fractured. Neku looks down disbelievingly and says, "Uh huh." Neku pokes the window plane of Shibuya and continues, "And who told you that?" A close up of Haz's mouth, with a wide, thin smile. On a black background, Haz says "Joshua."

Comic page 4 of 5. Neku looks at Haz, shocked. Flashback to Joshua, smile wide and almost unnatural, arms spread and falling apart, dissolving. Neku says, "You can't just use nicknames and become friends. You have to work for it." Panels of smiling Player Shiki and Beat. Neku continues, "Otherwise it's not genuine."

Comic page 5 of 5. "Is that, how it works?" Haz asks looking up. Neku looks over to him, conflicted or uncertain by Haz's reaction and tone. Neku draws his hood up and looks back down at Shibuya's window plane. "Yeah" Neku responds. His hand touches the plane, the plane lighting up where Neku touches it, "something like that."

title: Hazuki Sketches
summary: Hazuki practice based in game movie expressions and on official(?) art. These were fun emotions to try to capture because you don't see them in his in game sprites so it's neat to see him looking concerned/conflicted or something along those lines.

In the third, he's looking down and to his left, our right, mouth closed and eye brows furrowed. He looks concerned or worried about something.

title: Two Totez Besties Drawin’
summary: Post NTWEWY AU: Hanekoma and Coco are drawing Minamimoto’s refinery sigil? Together? And why… What is Hanekoma lecturing Coco about? Some backstory, answers and the sigil below.
details:
I skipped a couple parts here after the comic where Hanekoma runs into Kaie, Rhyme, Coco and Minamimoto. After ironing out some details about Angels and kinda sorta Higher Planes things, Hanekoma gifts Rhyme and Kaie with some protective feathers in case they do want to get involved with the Higher Plane. (For whatever good it will do, but he did try to warn them!)

Then he has a chat with Coco and Minamimoto outside and away from Kaie’s shop. There’s some choice words from Coco about where Hanekoma has been the past three years and lecturing from Hanekoma to them about their aims towards the Higher Plane, the dangers of Minamimoto absorbing dangerous and unknown things, and the effect of Coco’s sigil on Minamimoto.

Then there’s talk about getting Minamimoto his proper body back, not some “cleaned up” version that Minamimoto has now due to Coco’s copying of the sigil. (He’s missing one whisker!! And perhaps some cool tattoos. Ones that aren’t actual(?) taboo. We don’t need overloaded taboo Minamimoto again.) A combined version of what he had before and now might be the form Minamimoto wants.

While Hanekoma and Coco bicker about who will be involved with drawing the sigil and how they will…destroy…Minamimoto’s current body (can’t revive something that already exists) Minamimoto decides to take the second half into his own hands and for one reason or another - maybe he tries to tune into a higher plane that he can’t exist in, conduct an experiment, maybe he just blows himself up (as you do) - he destroys his own body, again, leaving Coco and Hanekoma to revive Minamimoto.

Here’s the sigil you can kinda see on the ground with some draft details and labelling Hanekoma and Coco’s sides. Not everything is aligned properly but it was good enough for this drawing.

Since Coco allows Hanekoma to help her with the sigil (probably because she doesn’t quite remember it but she’s not going to admit that) so they split the work up. A fun idea that came up during stream and chats afterwards was what if Coco used her colours of green and pink/purple? (Would that affect anything?) Would Hanekoma lecture her on improper tool usage, if that’s a thing? Did Coco mess up pi’s digits? Are her fundamentals poor?

Whatever it is, Coco would appreciate any feedback with less snark.

A pretty neat sigil break down can be found in this fic, Postmortem Analysis, which gave me a great starting point as to what the sigil contained.

imgs.alt: Digital art of Sanae Hanekoma sitting down on the ground across from Coco Atarashi in her NEO pink dress from The World Ends With You. Hanekoma is wearing a white dress shirt, black sweats, and a dark blue hoodies wrapped around his waist. He is drawing Minamimoto's refinery sigil on the ground and has his left arm held out as if lecturing Coco on something. Hanekoma looks at her questioningly and maybe slightly annoyed, while Coco is very much not amused by Hanekoma.

REFALT1: Minamimoto's taboo noise refinery sigil, shown what parts were drawn by Hanekoma and Coco.

title: Totally Not A Gift On A Totally Not Special Day
summary: Father is simply impressed with Gatto Nero’s use of a cat shaped icon to gain popularity in the lower planes. That’s all.
details:
Timeline wise, I’m thinking this takes place between TWEWY and NEO. Maybe shortly after NEO, before the Health Dose of Chaos AU kicks in. Location wise…If it’s not specified it’s probably in the HP, and they drawn with “lines and colour” because…I feel like it. We have no idea what Angels will look like in the HP so I’ll switch between styles depending on what I want to do.

(I suppose you could say it’s our perception of them that changes but let’s not go down that path right now.)

“Spoilers” I guess for the background of this cause the reveal of the cushion’s source for the eventual follow up is…forever away. And I’ve brought it up on stream before, so I’ll share it here. Joshua contacted Shiki to get the cushion hand made, so Father can sense this cushion is constructed a bit differently, perhaps similar to how the original Mr. Mew was compared to say, Mr. Mew dolls that would be sold at stores. Joshua did not disclose who the cushion was for, and perhaps some day down the line, she might find out.

But anyways, this is totally not a gift, just something Joshua doesn’t want back, and definitely not given on a particular day whatsoever. It will take a while for Father to realize what the cushion was for.

imgs.alt:
Comic of Joshua from NEO: The World Ends With You, giving Father, an Original Character, a gift. Joshua throws something, saying "Heads up, Father!" 

Father catches it using telekinetic powers with a single finger raised. He studies the cushion & thinks "This is...Soft black fabric. Twin innocent bands of eyes. Curious little T shaped nose. Gatto Nero's mascot." He rubs the fabric. "In a flattened, severed head form. But it radiates warmth. Carefully constructed. It's..." He tucks the cushion under his chin as he concludes in his thoughts: "A handmade cushion?" with the dotted "i" of "cushion" as a heart. He squishes the cushion as he asks Joshua. "So, Joshua, what's the occasion? New room decor? Shibuya preservation?"

Joshua frowns and grips his phone at the words "Shibuya preservation." Then he smiles and snaps a picture of Father with the cushion and says "To fuel you cat addiction". A chibi Father stretches the cushion and then says, "Joshua, listen VERY carefully" as he lectures Joshua. Joshua responds with "Of course, Father."
Hazuki Mikagi, a charatcer from NEO The Worl Ends With You, with a white border, looking straight ahead with a small smile on his face. The words "Happy Birthday Hazuki!! 2022.5.5" is written on it.

title: Yoshi-nii
summary: One brand new Angel Hazuki Mikagi gets picked up by the same Mother and Father as Joshua. What a wonderful family!
details:
This wasn’t originally planned when I started designing Mother and 
Father but when asked if Haz and Josh shared the same parents and 
“Yoshi-nii” (Older Brother Yoshi) was brought up on stream while working
 on Father’s design, I had to draw something for it!

imgs.alt: Mother and Father introducing Hazuki to Joshua, all in glowing, angelic forms. Hazuki calls Joshua "Yoshi-nii", shocking Joshua and amusing Mother and Father.

imgs.alt: Art of Joshua wearing a light blue Yoshi hoodie, side view, with dramatic rim lighting behind him.
Art of a darkened Joshua wearing Yoshi hoodie with eerie lighting and odd pattern over top the image.

title: They Call It Teamwork (Joshua + Minamimoto)
summary:
If there’s fighting involved, this team up would be the one I think everyone would avoid. But when the situation does call for it, they do know how to…play nice.

Also, They are watching.

2024 update: Aadded a more coloured version to spice up the first one.
details:
Since Noise are too low level for the Higher Plane and I want something equivalent, I tried combining the concept of Soul Pulvis (no organic body, graffiti pattern only) and CAT’s style into one form. Using CAT’s style in the HP was something I’ve been wanting to do for a while to play with the idea that CAT’s style is inspired by the Higher Plane. I don’t know if I’ll stick with that design choice, probably go less organic for general designs but I wanted to try this out.

The rings are…there. Something something Angels dwelling in the rings and watching which is absolutely not conveyed I don’t think cause I was done with the piece.

imgs.alt: Digital art of Joshua and Minamimoto in a fight against some not visible being throughing a fiery purple and yellow ball at them. Joshua telekinetically grabbed Minamimoto and tossed him out of harms way. Minamimoto is frustrated at Joshua. The arena is surrounded by a multilayered scribbly multicoloured border with glowing Angel Souls watching the fight.

Digital art of Joshua and Minamimoto in a fight against some not visible being throughing a fiery blue ball at them. Joshua telekinetically grabbed Minamimoto and tossed him out of harms way. Minamimoto is frustrated at Joshua. The arena is surrounded by a multilayered scribbly border with glowing Angel Souls watching the fight.

Digital art of Minamimoto vaulting over Joshua in a fight to avoid a swipe from the bear like creature and to launch himself towards the creature to attack it. His right hand is pushing down on Joshua's head and his other hand and two feet are glowing with a fiery colour in the shape of Soul Pulvis. Joshua is displeased by being pushed down. The fight is contained in a black scribbly border with two rings, one red and one blue, circle outside the border.

title: There Was A Time When…
summary:
Some of them who know what I am occasionally try to contact me, but I cannot respond.

    My old café on Cat Streetーthe one that served as my base three years agoーis always open to them. I hear that some drop by on occasion.
details: Inspired by the above NEO Secret Report with an appearance of the everchanging library and scenes from the fic Signal, Noise and Distortion as a bonus. In the fic, Hanekoma has a backroom called “the everchanging library”. The books always seem to have what is required. So to further show that since Hanekoma isn’t around, his library only contains blank books. While it’s ambiguous about what sort of relationship Minamimoto and Hanekoma had, I have a feeling Minamimoto would have at some point sought out Hanekoma since he wanted to save Shibuya before. So, where the factor are you now? Bonus: Books! “Fractals: Form, Chance and Dimension” by Benoit B. Mandelbrot“. The Consistency of the Continuum Synthesis” by Kurt Godel“Liber AL vel Legis” (“The Book of the Law”) by Aleister Crowley. Another book by Mandelbrot. Was intended to be “Multifractals and 1/f Noise: Wild Self Affinity” but it the title got covered up. And then: “Pythagorean Triangles” by Waclaw Sierpinski. “Theatrum Chemicum Brittanicum” by Elias Ashmole. “Transcendental Magic” by Eliphas Levi. “Cardinal and Ordinal Numbers” by Waclaw Sierpinski.

imgs.alt: The first panel shows sign says "Mystery Circle" witha paw print and scratch lines to the left of the words on a building. The second panel shows an empty and dark café with a hooded figure looking at it. The third panel reveals the hooded figure is Sho Minamimoto with a frown. His eyes are hidden by the shadows of his hood and cap.

In the first panel Minamimoto slams down on the countertop. In the second panel he looks up to the doors at the back of the café. Third panel is a side view and mouth slightly open. Fourth panel zooms in on the doors he's looking at. Fifth panel is a flashback to Hanekoma leading Sho Minamimoto through the doors.

First panel, back in the present, Minamimoto pushes open the door. In the second panel, Minamimoto is looking at a small backroom filled with bookcases containing blank books, a chair, tables, a coffee apparatus, and art supplies all over. There is a tiny window at the upper left corner of the room providing some light. The third, fourth and fifth panels are flashbacks. The third is Hanekoma showing Minamimoto a book called "Fractals: Form, Chance and Dimension" by Benoit B. Mandelbrot. In the bookbase behind them some book titles are partially visible: "The Consistency of the Continuum Synthesis" by Kurt Godel, "Liber AL vel Legis" ("The Book of the Law") by Aleister Crowley and a book by Mandelbrot. The fourth is a close up of Minamimoto's mouth looking unsure, the fifth is a fang-y grin.

First panel is a flashback of some books on the bookshelf with titles on their spines. The partially visible spines are from the following books: "Pythagorean Triangles" by Waclaw Sierpinski, "Theatrum Chemicum Brittanicum" by Elias Ashmole, "Transcendental Magic" by Eliphas Levi, "Cardinal and Ordinal Numbers" by Waclaw Sierpinski. The second panel is back in present day, with the same shot as the first but the spines are all now blank, and Minamimoto is reaching out to one of the books. The third panel shows Minamimoto looking at the other bookbase, which also has all the book spines blank. In the fourth panel, Minamimoto sits down in the chair by the book cases, head in heads, shown from a high angle. In the fifth panel he looks up, with a mix of anger and frustration, and maybe a bit of hurt, shown by his mouth.

Digital art of Rhyme from NEO The World Ends With You sitting with her knees drawn up and holding her phone. She's looking at the viewer with a smile on her face. Text says "Happy Birthday Rhyme!! 2022.1.20"

title: Hoodie Buddies!
summary: The Hoodie Buddy Gang grows! KuboKupo, HazuKweh and Yoshi…ya.
details:
• Haz and Kubo’s outfits are based on the FFXIII versions of Chocobos and Moogles
  • Haz gets two adornments cause why not
  • One adornment is the special red chocobo that has the Crazy Chocobo theme. The intensity of it is kiiinda similar to some parts of the World Is Yours but the main part is it’s red/kinda colourful like the Phoenix Cantus
  • The other adornment is the white one which is based on the Angel of Valhalla. He gets it because… Angel
  • Kubo gets Mog's Clock staff cause Time Things!

imgs.alt: Comic page 1. Kubo says "And - there" as a red chocobo figurine appears on Haz's shoulder, who is wearing a yellow chocobo hoodie. Kubo is wearing his Mog moogie hoodie. Kubo tells Haz "Now, say it." Haz says "Kupo" and Kubo tells him "No, no, no, yours is 'Kweh!'" Haz responds with an attempted enthusiastic "...Kweh" and Kubo responds "Ah, well, good enough". Joshua watches them. Haz notices and greets him, "Hey, Joshua. Here to join us?" Joshua responds, trying not to laugh, "Oh, no. Just seeing what the fuss was about. Besides I-"

Comic page 2. Kubo leans over to Haz, "I've got the perfect outfit." Haz responds with "Oh?" Joshua continues, "-So there's no need to-" but gets cut off by Kubo laughing and dramatically points the Mog Clock staff at Joshua and saying, "One special hoodie, for one-". Joshua is now wearing a green Yoshi hoodie. Kubo finishes his sentence, "-YOSHI-ya Kiryu!" Joshua is less than impressed under the hood.
Close up of Joshua's eye from beneath the nose on the Yoshi hoodie. He is very annoyed, and a light blue light gleams in his eyes.

title: HazuKweh!
summary: For this site, I combined some versions! Originally it was a light background and the hoodie had closed eyes. Then I made an open eyed version for fun a little while later (Dec 2021). The purple background version has existed since I originally made it but I didn't like it at the time so I didn't post it. But I like it now, looking at it again almost 3 years later (Sept. 2024), so we get to see it here!
details: Styled after the Final Fanstasy XIII chocobo design. Closer match to the reference I used: https://www.pinterest.ca/pin/101260691595155440. ​​https://www.deviantart.com/kaypikefashion/art/Cute-Yellow-Chicken-Hoodie-193095268​​​.​​

imgs.alt: Art of Hazuki Mikagi in a chocobo hoodie with a purple background.
Art of Hazuki Mikagi in a chocobo hoodie which has opened blue eyes on the hoodie. Styled after the XIII chocobo design.

title: Kubo, Higher Vibe Frequency.
summary: What if the glowy Composer form is just a higher vibe frequency form? Kubo gets an earthy colour palette from his talking panel backgrounds, colour scheme and intro card. Soul Pulvis gradient was for contrast and a warmer association to their in game colour.
details:
This was just going to be “regular” Kubo with the Soul Pulvis but as I started working on the birds I was like, wait a sec, there was a reason why I thought the birds were Composer related in the demo with their aura and greyscale design.

Since some people can see the Soul Pulvis, maybe it’s similar to how lesser Reapers can’t perceive the Composer. There could be an Imagination requirement to see the Soul Pulvis which fits for why Rindo, Minamimoto, Beat and Neku can see them. (Rindo’s might be because of his pin I don’t feel like digging through the SR.)
Does this mean I’ll be using this form for Angels? Probably or at least occasionally.

imgs.alt: Art of a glowing Kubo with Soul Pulvis flying around. A Soul Pulvis perches on his raised right arm like a bird. Kubo has s gradient from brown to yellow to green and to blue. The Soul Pulvis have a gradient from yellow to orange to red.
Art of a glowing Kubo with Soul Pulvis flying around. A Soul Pulvis perches on his raised right arm like a bird. In greyscale.

title: Didn’t You Know? The Dead Don’t Age
summary: What if Neku didn’t age. (It’s ok he would get fixed up but until then he’s getting a hug!!)

imgs.alt: Page 1 of 2 of a digital comic of Beat and Neku from NEO The World Ends With You. Beats sees a shorter, 15 year old Neku. Panel of Neku holding his arm. Beat says "You, You haven't..." Close up on Neku's half smile. Neku says "Beat, the Dead don't age." Beat tries to cut in, "But" Neku cuts him off There's nothing you can do about it"

Page 2 of 2 of a digital comic. Neku tears up and says "It's...It's okay Beat... I'm-" Beat cuts him off with a hug. Neku's shocked eyes can be seen over Beat's shoulder. "Listen up, Phones! We're gonna win and get you fixed up." From Beat's perspective, he continues "I'll go beat up prissy kid if I have to." Side view of Neku returning the hug, Beat continues. "There's no way I'mma let you lose more than you already have. You got that?" Neku replies, "...Thanks, Beat"
